headline: **Headline:** CryptoPotato - Bitcoin & Altcoins, Crypto News and Guides
content:
**Headline:** CryptoPotato - Bitcoin & Altcoins, Crypto News and Guides

    **Content:**
    Recent reports indicate that the U.S. Consumer Price Index (CPI) has been steadily rising, with year-over-year inflation at 1.7%. This is a significant departure from the 2.1% inflation rate seen in 2018. In addition, the Federal Reserve has been hesitant to lower interest rates, despite calls from some economists to do so. As a result, the cryptocurrency market has seen a significant drop in value, with Bitcoin trading below $100,000 for the first time since November 2020. Analysts believe that this could be due to macroeconomic factors
